language.entry: %d%% chance to absorb debuffs when attacked
Damage Block tokens, also known as "Aegis tokens", absorb 100% of the physical damage from the next attack that strikes the hero.
Pistol Shot: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} +10%% Damage Received (4 rds) (120%%)
Plague Grenade: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} -25%% {colour_start|healhp}Heal{colour_end} Received & -12 ACC (3 rds) (120%%)
Double Stress Heal Received from Beast/Man
Rake: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} +8%% Crit Received Chance (3 rds) (120%%)
Sniper Shot: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} +15%% Damage Received (2 rds) (120%%)
Collect Bounty: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} -20%% PROT & -6 Dodge (3 rds) (120%%)
Flashbang: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} -8 ACC (3 rds) (120%%)
Come Hither: On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} -12 Dodge & -1 Speed (2 rds) (120%%)
On Friendly Skill: Self: {colour_start|move}Move{colour_end} Back 1 & +1 Speed for 2rds
Thrown Dagger: {colour_start|debuff}Target:{colour_end} -20%% {colour_start|healhp}Healing Received{colour_end} / -10%% Damage / -6%% CRIT (3 rds) (120%%)
On Friendly Skill: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Monsters{colour_end}: -25%% {colour_start|stress}Horror{colour_end} Amount & -6 Dodge (3 rds) (120%%)
On Friendly Skill: Self: +20%% {colour_start|bleed}Bleed{colour_end} Chance & +25%% {colour_start|bleed}Bleed{colour_end} Amount (2 rds)
On Hit: Self: +20%% {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Healing Done & Clear {colour_start|stress}Horror{colour_end} (2 rds)
Swarms of summer larks, fleeing the autumn wind.
Lions in the savanna. A lone campfire.
Red rubies glitter in the trove of night.
A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
She eats only what she makes, the ailing dowager.
To the lizard, it is clear: sacrifice or death.
Carve away the numb flesh and expose the man within.
They rush, these lemmings, to the cliff's edge...
Ants at a spring picnic. Wine spilled in the heath.
A crack in the chamber room window. Snow swirls in...
Cobwebs in the dining hall. Weevils in the crust!
Even steel may shatter in the cold.
Grey seven apple-court in Autumn. Battle-born.
Where what blade throne calls under winter.
The blackest night yields to brightest dawn.
The honeybee to his nectar, by the queen's command.
A river-dragon in the heart of the ocean.
Nothing stands in the path of an avalanche.
The death-cap grows -- thrives -- in the shade.
The sun is brightest after darkest night.
Power is the gift of fearlessness. It is always so.
Mists on the moor! Shadows marshaling in the gloom!
Blood and rain in the muddy bootprints...
Yearn cobra in elder days. A forest of black.
Iron sleeps in sunshine. Grey. Redemptive.
Standard bearer sleeps cold moorland. Blazing charge.
Even mighty summer yields to awesome winter.
At the press of twilight, the sun flees.
Pound severed in the abattoir! Betray the morning star!
Return of Spring. Call down the galleons. Nightly.
Rage in the armory. Sell-swords bargain. Inheritance.

On Hit: All Monsters -10%% PROT (3 rds) (120%%)

Once owned by a infamous pirate king, these pistols are now greatly desired by many pirates.
These tools were once used by skilled highwayman. Known by many because of his clever use of smoke bombs.

There was once a ship dedicated to tracking down pirate ships and sinking them to the bottom of the sea. There was one crafty crew member that created hand held bombs that would stick to the hull of a ship before detonating.

Long ago, there was a vestal part of a crusade. They ran into a cult unknowingly and were quickly overrun. Many made it out alive because she stayed behind to keep the cultists back. Which ultimately lead to her demise.
Recovered by mercenaries during a raid on a tribal camp. The chieftan of the tribe cut down half of the mercenary group before being hit by multiple crossbow bolts.
On Hit: {colour_start|debuff}Debuff Target:{colour_end} +8%% Crit Received (3 rds) (120%%)
On Kill: Deal 3 Damage to Other Monsters
On Kill: Other Monsters: -8 ACC (3 rd) (120%%)
On Hit: Self {colour_start|healhp}Heal{colour_end} 5%% of Max HP

On Hit: All Monsters: -8 ACC (3 rds) (120%%)

Increases damage by 10% when attacking 'Unholy' monsters
Increases damage by 10% when torch light is below 50
Increases damage by 10% when attacking 'Beast' monsters

Swarms of summer larks, fleeing the autumn wind.
Lions in the savanna. A lone campfire.
Red rubies glitter in the trove of night.
A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
She eats only what she makes, the ailing dowager.
To the lizard, it is clear: sacrifice or death.
Carve away the numb flesh and expose the man within.
They rush, these lemmings, to the cliff's edge...
Ants at a spring picnic. Wine spilled in the heath.
A crack in the chamber room window. Snow swirls in...
Cobwebs in the dining hall. Weevils in the crust!
Even steel may shatter in the cold.
Grey seven apple-court in Autumn. Battle-born.
Where what blade throne calls under winter.
The blackest night yields to brightest dawn.
The honeybee to his nectar, by the queen's command.
A river-dragon in the heart of the ocean.
Nothing stands in the path of an avalanche.
The death-cap grows -- thrives -- in the shade.
The sun is brightest after darkest night.
Power is the gift of fearlessness. It is always so.
Mists on the moor! Shadows marshaling in the gloom!
Blood and rain in the muddy bootprints...
Yearn cobra in elder days. A forest of black.
Iron sleeps in sunshine. Grey. Redemptive.
Standard bearer sleeps cold moorland. Blazing charge.
Even mighty summer yields to awesome winter.
At the press of twilight, the sun flees.
Pound severed in the abattoir! Betray the morning star!
Return of Spring. Call down the galleons. Nightly.
Rage in the armory. Sell-swords bargain. Inheritance.

Once owned by a infamous pirate king, these pistols are now greatly desired by many pirates.
These tools were once used by skilled highwayman. Known by many because of his clever use of smoke bombs.

There was once a ship dedicated to tracking down pirate ships and sinking them to the bottom of the sea. There was one crafty crew member that created hand held bombs that would stick to the hull of a ship before detonating.

Long ago, there was a vestal part of a crusade. They ran into a cult unknowingly and were quickly overrun. Many made it out alive because she stayed behind to keep the cultists back. Which ultimately lead to her demise.
Recovered by mercenaries during a raid on a tribal camp. The chieftan of the tribe cut down half of the mercenary group before being hit by multiple crossbow bolts.

A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
She eats only what she makes, the ailing dowager.
To the lizard, it is clear: sacrifice or death.
Carve away the numb flesh and expose the man within.
They rush, these lemmings, to the cliff's edge...
Ants at a spring picnic. Wine spilled in the heath.
A crack in the chamber room window. Snow swirls in...
Cobwebs in the dining hall. Weevils in the crust!
Even steel may shatter in the cold.
Grey seven apple-court in Autumn. Battle-born.
Where what blade throne calls under winter.
The blackest night yields to brightest dawn.
The honeybee to his nectar, by the queen's command.
A river-dragon in the heart of the ocean.
Nothing stands in the path of an avalanche.
The death-cap grows -- thrives -- in the shade.
The sun is brightest after darkest night.
Power is the gift of fearlessness. It is always so.
Mists on the moor! Shadows marshaling in the gloom!
Blood and rain in the muddy bootprints...
Yearn cobra in elder days. A forest of black.
Iron sleeps in sunshine. Grey. Redemptive.
Standard bearer sleeps cold moorland. Blazing charge.
Even mighty summer yields to awesome winter.
At the press of twilight, the sun flees.
Pound severed in the abattoir! Betray the morning star!
Return of Spring. Call down the galleons. Nightly.
Rage in the armory. Sell-swords bargain. Inheritance.

Once owned by a infamous pirate king, these pistols are now greatly desired by many pirates.
These tools were once used by skilled highwayman. Known by many because of his clever use of smoke bombs.

There was once a ship dedicated to tracking down pirate ships and sinking them to the bottom of the sea. There was one crafty crew member that created hand held bombs that would stick to the hull of a ship before detonating.

Long ago, there was a vestal part of a crusade. They ran into a cult unknowingly and were quickly overrun. Many made it out alive because she stayed behind to keep the cultists back. Which ultimately lead to her demise.
Recovered by mercenaries during a raid on a tribal camp. The chieftan of the tribe cut down half of the mercenary group before being hit by multiple crossbow bolts.

Once owned by a infamous pirate king, these pistols are now greatly desired by many pirates.
These tools were once used by skilled highwayman. Known by many because of his clever use of smoke bombs.

There was once a ship dedicated to tracking down pirate ships and sinking them to the bottom of the sea. There was one crafty crew member that created hand held bombs that would stick to the hull of a ship before detonating.

Long ago, there was a vestal part of a crusade. They ran into a cult unknowingly and were quickly overrun. Many made it out alive because she stayed behind to keep the cultists back. Which ultimately lead to her demise.
Recovered by mercenaries during a raid on a tribal camp. The chieftan of the tribe cut down half of the mercenary group before being hit by multiple crossbow bolts.

Swarms of summer larks, fleeing the autumn wind.
Lions in the savanna. A lone campfire.
Red rubies glitter in the trove of night.
A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
She eats only what she makes, the ailing dowager.
To the lizard, it is clear: sacrifice or death.
Carve away the numb flesh and expose the man within.
They rush, these lemmings, to the cliff's edge...
Ants at a spring picnic. Wine spilled in the heath.
A crack in the chamber room window. Snow swirls in...
Cobwebs in the dining hall. Weevils in the crust!
Even steel may shatter in the cold.
Grey seven apple-court in Autumn. Battle-born.
Where what blade throne calls under winter.
The blackest night yields to brightest dawn.
The honeybee to his nectar, by the queen's command.
A river-dragon in the heart of the ocean.
Nothing stands in the path of an avalanche.
The death-cap grows -- thrives -- in the shade.
The sun is brightest after darkest night.
Power is the gift of fearlessness. It is always so.
Mists on the moor! Shadows marshaling in the gloom!
Blood and rain in the muddy bootprints...
Yearn cobra in elder days. A forest of black.
Iron sleeps in sunshine. Grey. Redemptive.
Standard bearer sleeps cold moorland. Blazing charge.
Even mighty summer yields to awesome winter.
At the press of twilight, the sun flees.
Pound severed in the abattoir! Betray the morning star!
Return of Spring. Call down the galleons. Nightly.
Rage in the armory. Sell-swords bargain. Inheritance.

Once owned by a infamous pirate king, these pistols are now greatly desired by many pirates.
These tools were once used by skilled highwayman. Known by many because of his clever use of smoke bombs.

There was once a ship dedicated to tracking down pirate ships and sinking them to the bottom of the sea. There was one crafty crew member that created hand held bombs that would stick to the hull of a ship before detonating.

Long ago, there was a vestal part of a crusade. They ran into a cult unknowingly and were quickly overrun. Many made it out alive because she stayed behind to keep the cultists back. Which ultimately lead to her demise.
Recovered by mercenaries during a raid on a tribal camp. The chieftan of the tribe cut down half of the mercenary group before being hit by multiple crossbow bolts.

Swarms of summer larks, fleeing the autumn wind.
Lions in the savanna. A lone campfire.
Red rubies glitter in the trove of night.
A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
She eats only what she makes, the ailing dowager.
To the lizard, it is clear: sacrifice or death.
Carve away the numb flesh and expose the man within.
They rush, these lemmings, to the cliff's edge...
Ants at a spring picnic. Wine spilled in the heath.
A crack in the chamber room window. Snow swirls in...
Cobwebs in the dining hall. Weevils in the crust!
Even steel may shatter in the cold.
Grey seven apple-court in Autumn. Battle-born.
Where what blade throne calls under winter.
The blackest night yields to brightest dawn.
The honeybee to his nectar, by the queen's command.
A river-dragon in the heart of the ocean.
Nothing stands in the path of an avalanche.
The death-cap grows -- thrives -- in the shade.
The sun is brightest after darkest night.
Power is the gift of fearlessness. It is always so.
Mists on the moor! Shadows marshaling in the gloom!
Blood and rain in the muddy bootprints...
Yearn cobra in elder days. A forest of black.
Iron sleeps in sunshine. Grey. Redemptive.
Standard bearer sleeps cold moorland. Blazing charge.
Even mighty summer yields to awesome winter.
At the press of twilight, the sun flees.
Pound severed in the abattoir! Betray the morning star!
Return of Spring. Call down the galleons. Nightly.
Rage in the armory. Sell-swords bargain. Inheritance.
